title: Captain John Smith Chesapeake National Historic Trail: Outdoor Activities
body: Outdoor Activities         A Captain John Smith Geocoin is awarded for logging 15 discovered caches along the CJS Geotrail National Park Service Chesapeake Bay Office  The 3,000 miles of water routes making up the Captain John Smith Chesapeake National Historic Trail pass through diverse landscapes offering opportunities for outdoor recreation to suit every interest. Go geocaching along the Captain John Smith Geotrail and explore close to fifty places associated with the adventures of Captain Smith and his crew. It's free, and fun for the whole family! Discover and record at least fifteen hidden treasures in your CJS Passport and earn a limited edition geocoin. Consult the Boater's Guide and head out on a river to see the Chesapeake through the eyes of Captain John Smith. Download the whole Guide or just the section you want to explore. Be sure to read the safety tips and click through to navigation charts so you fully understand the nature of the waters in the area you will explore. Check out www.FindYourChesapeake.com to find the best places for boating, paddling, hiking, biking, fishing, camping, bird and wildlife viewing, and much, much more.
